title: Boat ownership by age in the U.S. 2013
summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Age (in years), and Own a boat in each Age (in years) on the y axis.
Age (in years) 16 to 34 has the highest Own a boat and 65+ has the lowest Own a boat.
The highest Age (in years) 16 to 34 has 2.2 more Own a boat than the lowest Age (in years) 65+.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Age (in years) in the x axis and Own a boat in the y axis.
The Own a boat is appeared to be the highest at Age (in years) 16 to 34 and lowest at Age (in years) 65+.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Age (in years), and Own a boat in each Age (in years) on the y axis.
Age (in years) 16 to 34 has the highest Own a boat and 65+ has the lowest Own a boat.
The highest Age (in years) 16 to 34 has 2.2 more Own a boat than the lowest Age (in years) 65+.
max_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Age (in years), and Own a boat in each Age (in years) on the y axis.
The Own a boat is highest at Age (in years) 16 to 34 and lowest at Age (in years) 65+.
There is a difference of 2.2 between the maximum Age (in years) 16 to 34 and minimum Age (in years) 65+.
The Age (in years) 16 to 34 has the highest Own a boat, followed by 35 to 44, and 45 to 64. Down to the Age (in years) 65+ which is the lowest.
The Age (in years) 16 to 34 has 1.13 times more Own a boat than average.
Summing up the values of all Age (in years)s, we get total 36.4.
